question.text: An experiment takes <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mi>min</mi></math> to raise the temperature of water in a container from <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>0</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>100</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> and another <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>55</mn><mo> </mo><mi>min</mi></math> to convert it totally into steam by a heater supplying heat at a uniform rate. Neglecting the specific heat of the container and taking specific heat of the water to be <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi>cal</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> , the heat of vaporization according to this experiment will come out to be:

solution.text: Let the constant state of supply of heat per unit time <math><mo>=</mo><mi>λ</mi></math>. So according to the first condition. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>λ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>c</mi><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn><mi> </mi><mo>⇒</mo><mfrac><mi>λ</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>C</mi></mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>)</mo></math>, and according to the second condition, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>λ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>⇒</mo><mfrac><mi>λ</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo> </mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>.</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>ii</mi><mo>)</mo></math>. By <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>)</mo></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><mi>ii</mi><mo>)</mo></math> <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></math><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>⇒</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>cal</mi><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mn>55</mn></mfrac><mo>⇒</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>550</mn><mi> </mi><mi>cal</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>
